title: UP Warriorz Dominate RCB in WPL 2023: Alyssa Healy's 96 Powers 10-Wicket Win, RCB Remain Winless
content:
The **UP Warriorz** have secured a dominant 10-wicket victory over the struggling **Royal Challengers Bangalore** in the Women's Premier League 2023. This crushing defeat leaves RCB in a precarious position, facing a serious threat of elimination after their fourth consecutive loss.

The match was a complete mismatch, with **Alyssa Healy** leading the charge for UPW with a brilliant 96* off just 58 balls. She was well supported by **Devika Vaidya**, who remained unbeaten on 41. The duo's partnership of 139 runs remained unbroken, setting a new record for the highest opening partnership in the tournament. 

The **RCB bowling attack** struggled immensely, failing to contain the UPW batters. **Sophie Ecclestone** was the pick of the bowlers, taking four wickets, while **Deepti Sharma** bagged three scalps. 

On the other hand, RCB's batting faltered once again, failing to reach 150 runs for the fourth consecutive time. **Ellyse Perry** was the lone bright spot, scoring a half-century, but it was not enough to salvage their innings. 

This resounding victory puts UPW in a strong position in the points table, while RCB's hopes of reaching the playoffs are hanging by a thread. The team will need to find a way to turn things around quickly if they want to stay in the tournament.
author: Vinayakk Mohanarangan
